item.title: Report E-2023080771
item.description:
Report E-2023080771

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 8, 2023, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN2735 were crushed during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the spill and worked them in using hand tools. After utilizing a degreasing solution and absorbent pads, all waste was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080602
item.description:
Report E-2023080602

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 4, 2023 ,one (1) 1-gallon drum of sodium hydroxide was mishandled by an operator and released approximately one (1) gallon to the concrete floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed neutralizing absorbents to the sodium hydroxide-impacted floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews utilized hand tools to cut up the impacted pallet, and then proceeded to place the undamaged freight on another pallet. All spent absorbents, the empty container, the cut-up pallet, and miscellaneous cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080600
item.description:
Report E-2023080600

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 3, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2810 was crushed during transit and released less than one (<1) gallon of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews observed that the drum was not damaged and the release only impacted the top of the drum and was dried up. EWI personnel tightened the bungs on the drum and demobilized.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed flammable liquid package was located coming from the load ends and was noticeably wet. Further inspection of package confirmed that one of the bottles inside was damaged and leaking. DescribePack: Missing cap from one of the plastic bottles inside DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Placed under hood in haz cage and stood box upright to prevent further release of liquid product.

item.title: Report E-2023080346
item.description:
Report E-2023080346

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN2794 Battery, Wet, Filled with Acid release from an 1855-pound battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of battery acid released impacting a 4' x 4' area of the concrete bay below the trailer and a 5' x 12' area of the trailer floor. The battery tipped over during dock operations, losing a cell cap. Contractors were able to upright the battery and replace the cap and re-secure it for shipment on. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The waste was then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080571

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of seafoam (un1993) had been damaged by other freight and that one of the inner metal 1 gallon can had its lid pop off and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080485
item.description:
Report E-2023080485

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 28, 2023, one (1) 250-gallon tote of UN3266 leaked approximately ten (10) gallons of product due to a faulty valve. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. Crews transferred the product from the 330-gallon tote into one (1) 250-gallon tote and two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2023070882
item.description:
Report E-2023070882

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX INTERMODAL TERMINALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/14/23 at 1912hrs personnel with CSX Intermodal East St Louis, ILL Terminal discovered APHU659439, a freight container of "Freight All Kinds" with interior explosion and fire. The Fairmont City, IL fire department responded and extinguished the fire- no injuries were reported and no waterways impacted. Upon opening of the container, it was determined the lading included a hazardous commodity that was not described on the shipper's bill-of-lading; (UN3480, Lithium-Ion Batteries, Class 9, PG II). There were no indications of a hazardous material shipment on shipper's bill-of-lading or the freight container. CSXT emergency response contractor, ENVIROSERVE, was dispatched to the scene for cleanup after scene was released by the fire dept. The response contractor decontaminated all impacted areas and separated damaged lading into one roll-off unit. All damaged freight was transported to the customers facility for further handling. In addition to the shipment containing an undeclared hazardous materials, the cause of the fire/explsoin was due to inadequate blocking and bracing of the lading inside the container. This allowed the lading to rub against itself, creating arc-friction, resulting in an explosion with fire. The rail shipper, CMA-CGM America LLC, representative was notified by CSXI Customer Service, Case 672321. The Illinois EMA was notified, report# H-2023-0587.

item.title: Report I-2023070002
item.description:
Report I-2023070002

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AER LINGUS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment 125-59060116 was tendered to Aer Lingus in Chicago, IL on June 24,2023 from AIT Worldwide Logistics containing packages of Lithium Batteries Metal Batteries contained in equipment in compliance with Section Il of PI 970. The shipment was accepted and flown to Dublin on Aer Lingus flight EI122/24Jun. Upon arrival in Dublin, the shipment was investigated and found to have incorrect markings indicating the consignment actually contained fully regulated Lithium Batteries contained in equipment that had not been properly declared. The shipper provided an updated AWB and shippers declaration for the cargo after it had already been flown from Chicago from Dublin.
